titles.title: Private Party Judicial Fairness Act of 2002
To amend title 28, United States Code, to provide prejudgment interest on certain judgments against the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration, Border Security, and Claims.

bill.summary: 10/10/2002--Introduced. Private Party Judicial Fairness Act of 2002 - Amends the Federal judicial code to provide that interest on a claim against the United States shall be allowed in a judgment of the United States Court of Federal Claims from the date the suit was filed. (Currently, such interest is allowed only as expressly provided under a contract or Act of Congress.)
